Topic: Law
Context: Exactly eight books—F, G, H, I, K, L, M, O—are placed on a bookcase with exactly three shelves—the top shelf, the middle shelf, and the bottom shelf. At least two books are placed on each shelf. The following conditions must apply: More of the books are placed on the bottom shelf than the top shelf. I is placed on the middle shelf. K is placed on a higher shelf than F. O is placed on a higher shelf than L. F is placed on the same shelf as M.
Question: It is fully determined which of the shelves each of the books is placed on if which one of the following is true?
Choices:
  A: I and M are placed on the same shelf as each other.
  B: K and G are placed on the same shelf as each other.
  C: L and F are placed on the same shelf as each other.
  D: M and H are placed on the same shelf as each other.
  E: H and O are placed on the same shelf as each other.
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Advice:
- Always read the question and conditions carefully.
- Do not make assumptions that are not supported by the conditions.
- Use logical reasoning to determine the effects of each choice.
- Be careful not to misinterpret the conditions.

Thought: 
The conditions state that I is on the middle shelf, K is higher than F, O is higher than L, and F and M are on the same shelf. 
If I and M are on the same shelf (Choice A), it doesn't determine the placement of all books. 
If K and G are on the same shelf (Choice B), it doesn't determine the placement of all books. 
If L and F are on the same shelf (Choice C), since F is on the same shelf as M and K is higher than F, K must be on the top shelf. O is higher than L, so O must also be on the top shelf. Since more books are on the bottom shelf than the top shelf, F, L, and M must be on the bottom shelf. I is on the middle shelf, and the remaining books G and H must also be on the middle shelf to satisfy the condition that at least two books are on each shelf. 
If M and H are on the same shelf (Choice D), it doesn't determine the placement of all books. 
If H and O are on the same shelf (Choice E), it doesn't determine the placement of all books. 
Action: Answer("C")
